b'And we will also have to be willing to look squarely at the shortcomings of our own democracies\xe2\x80\x94not the ideal, but the reality. Only then will we be able to tell a better story of what democracy can be, and must be, in this rapidly changing world.'

b'The point is, if we want democracy to flourish, we will have to fight for it. We will have to nurture it. We will have to demonstrate its value, again and again, in improving the lives of ordinary people.'

b'In my own country, the forces that unleashed mob violence on our Capitol are still churning out misinformation and conspiracy theories. For those of us who fervently believe in the ideals of democracy, the question is: How do we respond?'

b'Just as disturbing, within democracies, populist appeals grounded in fear, bigotry, and resentment have elevated leaders who, once they\xe2\x80\x99re in office, have sought to systematically undermine democratic institutions and entrench themselves in power.'
b'On every continent, emboldened autocrats are ramping up oppression, they\xe2\x80\x99re targeting minority groups, they\xe2\x80\x99re often flouting international law.'

b'Yesterday, I talked about how we should be able to agree on some basic facts \xe2\x80\x93 including around issues like climate change \xe2\x80\x93 and how companies need to be more careful about the content they promote, especially in ads. This is a good example of progress. \nhttps://t.co/gNCvJlLnWK'

b'When it comes to climate change,\xc2\xa0time really is running out. Earth Day is a reminder that if we pledge to do our part and then follow through on those commitments, we can help preserve and protect our planet for future generations.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s up to each of us to decide what we value, and to use the tools we\xe2\x80\x99ve been given to advance those values. I believe we should use every tool at our disposal to secure our greatest gift \xe2\x80\x93 a government of, by, and for the people \xe2\x80\x93 for generations to come.'

b'Solving the disinformation problem won\xe2\x80\x99t cure all that ails our democracies or tears at the fabric of our world. But it can help rebuild the trust and solidarity needed to make democracy stronger.'
b'Each of us has to pick a side. Do we allow our democracy to wither? Or do we choose to make it better? That\xe2\x80\x99s the choice we face, and it is a choice worth embracing.'

b'As part of this, tech platforms need to recognize that they play a unique role in how people consume information, and their decisions have an impact on every aspect of society. \n\nWith that power comes accountability \xe2\x80\x93 and the need for some democratic oversight.'

b'The way I\xe2\x80\x99m going to evaluate any proposal touching on social media and the internet is whether it strengthens or weakens the prospects for healthy, inclusive democracy. https://t.co/jmPMO28KMU'

b'Progress often feels slow, and victories are sometimes incomplete. But the ACA shows that if you believe that we can improve people\xe2\x80\x99s lives, and if you\xe2\x80\x99re willing to work through obstacles and continually improve, you can make America better.'

b'But the ACA was never perfect, and we always knew we would have to make it better. That\xe2\x80\x99s what @POTUS has done since taking office. Today, he\xe2\x80\x99s going even further \xe2\x80\x93 lowering premiums for nearly 1 million people and helping 200,000 more uninsured Americans get access to coverage.'

b'The ACA also lowered prescription drug costs for 12 million seniors, and allowed young people to stay on their parents\xe2\x80\x99 plan. And it\xe2\x80\x99s eliminated lifetime limits on benefits that often put people in a jam.'

b'Because so many people made sacrifices and some members of Congress took courageous votes, we got the ACA across the finish line. Now, more than 30 million Americans have health coverage, and 135 million Americans with pre-existing conditions can\xe2\x80\x99t be dropped or denied coverage.'

b'Passing the ACA was incredibly difficult. People who had coverage were worried about losing it, the media was skeptical, misinformation was flying around, and Republicans showed no interest in working with us. But Joe, Harry Reid, Nancy Pelosi and I were determined.'

b'The Affordable Care Act is an example of why you run for office \xe2\x80\x93 not just to occupy a seat, but to make a difference in people\xe2\x80\x99s lives.\n\nToday I\xe2\x80\x99m joining @POTUS and @VP at the White House to celebrate everything the ACA has achieved, and help make it even better.'
b'Congratulations to the @KUHoops team on winning the national championship. This team was fun to watch, and they earned their first title since 2008 (which was a pretty good year).'

b'Congratulations to the @GamecockWBB team and coach @DawnStaley for winning the national championship. Coach Staley has built a powerhouse, and it\xe2\x80\x99s great to see all their hard work pay off. https://t.co/fZOOMKRmtC'

b'I heard Betty Reid Soskin is retiring at 100, and want to congratulate her for more than a decade of service as a National Park Ranger.\n\xc2\xa0\nBetty, I hope you realize just how many people appreciate everything you\xe2\x80\x99ve done\xe2\x80\x94myself included. https://t.co/lElFYwxVMg'

b'During the pandemic, the Affordable Care Act helped make vaccines and COVID-19 tests available for free, covered emergency hospitalizations, and prevented insurance companies from denying anyone coverage based on a pre-existing condition.'

b'12 years ago today, I signed the Affordable Care Act into law. I\xe2\x80\x99ve always believed that health care shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be a privilege for just a fortunate few, but a right for every American. \n\nToday, more than 30 million Americans have health coverage thanks to the Affordable Care Act. https://t.co/DmjgC00LpP'

b'Like Justice Breyer, Judge Jackson understands that the law isn\xe2\x80\x99t just about abstract theory. It\xe2\x80\x99s about people\xe2\x80\x99s lives. @POTUS Biden has made an excellent choice, and I look forward to seeing Judge Jackson confirmed.'

b'As a prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 of Justice Breyer, Judge Jackson earned a reputation for pragmatism and consensus building. It\xe2\x80\x99s part of why I nominated her twice \xe2\x80\x93 first as a district judge, and then to the U.S. Sentencing Commission, where she earned praise from both Democrats and Republicans.'

b'I want to congratulate Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson on her nomination to the Supreme Court. Judge Jackson has already inspired young Black women like my daughters to set their sights higher, and her confirmation will help them believe they can be anything they want to be. https://t.co/aCwiUBFTyj'

b'Last night, Russia launched a brazen attack on the people of Ukraine, in violation of international law and basic principles of human decency. Here\xe2\x80\x99s my statement on what it means, and what should happen next. https://t.co/Wa0C8XGwvK'

b'Michelle and I were sad to hear about the passing of Paul Farmer. His life was\xc2\xa0an example of how one man with vision and heart can change the world for the better.\xc2\xa0https://t.co/ww985hkV7j'

b'I want to thank everyone who has joined @AllOnTheLine in its mission to end gerrymandering. Every phone call, every testimony, every action has made a difference in the redistricting process. And while our fight for #FairMaps isn\xe2\x80\x99t over, we\xe2\x80\x99ve made real progress.'

b'And in Ohio, @AllOnTheLine held 139 training sessions\xe2\x80\x94equipping thousands of Ohioans from every corner of the state with the information and tools they need to fight for fair maps. And when the pandemic hit, All On The Line took its training online. https://t.co/DVWvLslKU4'

b'In North Carolina, Karla Icaza De Austin, an Army veteran from Fayetteville, urged her state legislators to demand transparency, accountability, and fairness in the redistricting process\xe2\x80\x94and reminded them of their duty to follow the will of the people. https://t.co/DhUwYbVTjl'

b'Since then, folks across the country have participated in the redistricting process\xe2\x80\x94many for the first time. It\xe2\x80\x99s a testament to the work @AllOnTheLine has done to help folks understand why fair maps matter, and make an impact in their communities.'

b'Three years ago, I helped @EricHolder launch @AllOnTheLine, a people-powered campaign to fight gerrymandering and advocate for fair redistricting. All On The Line is driven by the core belief that voters should choose their representatives\xe2\x80\x94not the other way around.'

b'John Lewis knew that change could not wait for some other person or some other time. His life was a lesson in the fierce urgency of now. On his birthday, let\xe2\x80\x99s honor his legacy by taking action and creating the change we hope to see in our own communities.'
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s exactly the kind of ambition we need if we\xe2\x80\x99re going to protect our planet and avoid the worst effects of climate change.'

b'Now the Biden-Harris Administration\xe2\x80\x99s Build Back Better Agenda includes an even larger investment that would create new jobs, help cut emissions in half by 2030, invest in coastal and soil conservation, and a lot more.'

b'.@JoeBiden played a major role in getting that passed\xe2\x80\x94and over our eight years in office, carbon emissions decreased by nine percent, while the U.S. economy grew by more than 10 percent.'

b'When I signed the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act in 2009, it included $90 billion for clean energy projects. At the time, it was the biggest investment in renewable energy in American history. https://t.co/C2AoEceGt8'

b'Azita Raji was a great friend and cherished member of my campaign team and administration who served our country with distinction. She represented the very best of America, and we are better off because of her leadership. She will be deeply missed.\xc2\xa0https://t.co/NmUOQ84poH'
b"Happy Valentine's Day, Michelle! With a smile that lights up the world, you're truly one-of-a-kind. Today and always, I am thankful to have you in my life. https://t.co/bAiCup2iiY"
b'Yes we can.\nYes we did.\nThanks to all of you who believed, volunteered, voted\xe2\x80\x94and then carried the baton forward in your communities. Keep at it. https://t.co/ueoKtaPDhd'

b'As we celebrate Black History Month, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to remember that we shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t treat this month as though it is somehow separate from our collective American history. Black history is American history.'

b'Today, we still have more work to do to create a more equitable workforce, but Lilly remains an inspiration to me and so many others. https://t.co/Lgo0PckkAJ'

b'The Biden Administration has set up a way for folks to get four at-home COVID tests for free. Go to https://t.co/ELjD6AatMb to order, or call their hotline at 1-800-232-0233. And if you need to get vaccinated or boosted, visit https://t.co/k4jKpPT5qo today.'

b"This Administration has also recommitted to the fight against climate change, and signed a crucial infrastructure law to improve roads and buildings across our country. And they're only getting started."

b'Under his leadership, our economy set the record for the most jobs added in a single year. Over 200 million people are now vaccinated against COVID-19. The American Rescue Plan provided relief to families. More people can now afford healthcare.'

b"The House just passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. Now the Senate needs to do the same. It's the best way to protect the right to vote, end partisan gerrymandering, and restore crucial parts of the Voting Rights Act."

b'That\xe2\x80\x99s why I fully support @POTUS\xe2\x80\x99s call to modify Senate rules as necessary to make sure pending voting rights legislation gets called for a vote. And every American who cares about the survival of our most cherished institutions should support the President\xe2\x80\x99s call as well.'

b'The filibuster has no basis in the Constitution, and in recent years, it has become a routine way for the Senate minority to block important progress on issues supported by the majority of voters. But we can\xe2\x80\x99t allow it to be used to block efforts to protect our democracy.'

b'Now is the time for the U.S. Senate to do the right thing and call a vote on crucial voting rights legislation. Future generations are counting on us to protect our democracy. I wrote out some thoughts about why this is so important. https://t.co/hjab4Ejxox'
b'I wanted to share some of those stories, and also hear about the work you\xe2\x80\x99ve been doing to create change: https://t.co/KhjWS3bFGo'

b'He never lost his impish sense of humor and willingness to find humanity in his adversaries, and Michelle and I will miss him dearly.'

b'But once again, progress is partial. Most nations have failed to be as ambitious as they need to be, and the escalation of ambition that we anticipated in Paris six years ago has not been uniformly realized.'

b'The good news is that countries around the world recognize this is a decisive decade if we want to avoid a climate disaster, and are setting important goals for 2030. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also promised to help countries move away from fossil fuels and deal with the effects of climate change.'

b'Now we need to keep it up. Because until every single American has access to quality, affordable health care, we have more work to do\xe2\x80\x94and I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful to President Biden for continuing to lead the fight.'

b'The American Rescue Plan lowers premiums for millions of families, makes health insurance more affordable for low-and middle-income Americans, and provides incentives for states to expand Medicaid and cover as many as four million additional Americans.'

b'And now, thanks to the hard work of President Biden, Senator Schumer, Speaker Pelosi, and Americans all across the country who have spent years fighting against repeal and pushing to improve the law, our starter home is starting to look pretty spacious.'
b'But I\xe2\x80\x99ve always said that the ACA is like a starter home\xe2\x80\x94it\xe2\x80\x99s our job to keep tinkering with it and improving it over time.'

b"The Affordable Care Act has helped 20 million Americans get coverage\xe2\x80\x94and up to 130 million Americans can no longer be denied coverage because of a preexisting condition. It has been a lifeline for Americans who've lost their jobs and their health insurance during the pandemic."

b'I know the past few months have been hard and dispiriting. But watching the heightened activism of young people makes me hopeful. And if we can keep channeling our justifiable anger into peaceful, sustained, and effective action, this can be the moment when real change starts.'

b'5. The more specific we can make demands for criminal justice and police reform, the harder it will be for elected officials to just offer lip service to the cause and then fall back into business as usual once protests have gone away.'

b'4. So if we want to bring about real change, the choice isn\xe2\x80\x99t between protest and politics\xe2\x80\x93\xe2\x80\x93we have to do both. We have to mobilize to raise awareness, and we have to organize and cast our ballots to make sure that we elect candidates who will act on reform.'

b'3. To do that, we have to know which levels of government have the biggest impact. Changing the federal government is important. But the elected officials who matter most in reforming police departments and the criminal justice system work at the state and local levels.'

b'2. The point of protest is to raise public awareness, to put a spotlight on injustice, and to make the powers that be uncomfortable. But eventually, we have to translate those aspirations into specific laws and institutional practices.'

b'1. The protests represent a genuine and legitimate frustration over a decades-long failure to reform police practices and the broader criminal justice system. We should condemn the few who resort to violence\xe2\x80\x93\xe2\x80\x93not the overwhelming majority who deserve our respect and support.'

b'"Now we have before us a solution that prevents Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon without resorting to war." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"President Kennedy warned Americans not to see conflict as inevitable. It is time to apply such wisdom.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"I have repeatedly challenged anyone opposed to this deal to put forward a better, plausible alternative." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"When we carefully examine the arguments against this deal, none of them stand up to scrutiny.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'

b'"Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" \xe2\x80\x94President Obama'
b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'\xe2\x80\x9cWalk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal\xe2\x80\x94for Iran.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'\xe2\x80\x9cThose who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran\'s support for terrorism and violation of human rights."\xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b"\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no scenario where sanctions relief turns Iran into the region's dominate power.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal"
b'\xe2\x80\x9cAn argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis deal is not just the best choice among alternatives\xe2\x80\x94this is the strongest non-proliferation agreement ever.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama'
b'\xe2\x80\x9cIf Iran violates the agreement over the next decade all of the sanctions can snap back in to place.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"Iran has powerful incentives to keep its commitments." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"This deal shuts off the type of covert program Iran has pursued in the past.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"In July, we reached a comprehensive plan of action that meets our objectives." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"What was once proclaimed as a historic mistake is now held up as a success." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b"\xe2\x80\x9cThe progress of Iran's nuclear program was halted for the first time in a decade.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal"
b'"It was diplomacy that ratcheted up the pressure on Iran." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"Winning this global buy-in was not easy. I know. I was there." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"What made our new approach more effective was our ability to draw upon new U.N. Security Council resolutions." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'\xe2\x80\x9cIt was our very willingness to negotiate that helped America rally the world to our cause.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
b'"I have also made clear my preference for a peaceful diplomatic resolution of the issue." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'

b'"Now more than ever, we need clear thinking in our foreign policy." \xe2\x80\x94President Obama #IranDeal'
